ContentClassification.TableReference: Prof. Rio Nogueira, “Tábua de Sobrevivência Bi-Dimensional”, Serviço Téchnicos de Estatística e Atuária, LTDA (Rio de Janeiro, 2012)
ContentClassification.TableDescription: Fundação Petrobras de Seguridade Social (PETROS) - Survival Probability of Triennium 2005-2007. Minimum Age: 18. Maximum Age: 120
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: Fundação Petrobras de Seguridade Social (PETROS), the second largest Brazilian pension fund, furnished data for years 1994-2010. Ultimately only the data related to the period 2002-2010 was used and the data grouped in triennia 2002-2004, 2005-2007, and 2008-2010. The author’s opinion is that there is no logical reason to assume that able-bodied population of PETROS would have a different mortality behavior than that of other pension funds. The Brazilian Central Statistics Office (IBGE) estimates Brazilian population life tables annually and said tables are limited by the quality of census information; correction factors are often implemented. However, the data, as maintained by PETROS, eliminates many of the issues raised by use of records based on civil registry. Methodology: Three mortality tables were constructed based on the grouped data and then adjusted by use of Makeham’s originally proposed function of 1860. The publication then also includes a 2-dimensional projection of future survival probabilities for years 2003 through 2122. NOTE: The published data is in px format however this database does not support survival probabilities but rather mortality probabilities, namely 1-px or qx. Hence the data has been converted with calculations of qx truncated at 6 decimals. Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 06/2014

MetaData.TableDescription: Fundação Petrobras de Seguridade Social (PETROS) - Survival Probability of Triennium 2005-2007. Minimum Age: 18. Maximum Age: 120
